City Council
============

The City Council is Bellingham’s legislative body, responsible for setting public policies, adopting long-range plans, approving the budget and taxes, and passing laws. Voters who live in Bellingham elect City Council Members. They serve four-year terms, except for the At-Large Council Member, who serves a two-year term.

[Subscribe to City Council newsletterSubscribe to City Council news](https://cob.org/gov/council/subscribe-to-city-council-news)

Contact us

Contact us
----------

Email all 7 Council Members at [ccmail@cob.org](mailto:ccmail@cob.org).   
Reach Council office staff at [councilstaff@cob.org](mailto:councilstaff@cob.org) or [360-778-8200](tel:13607788200).

[Meeting agendas & materials](https://meetings.cob.org)
[Agenda bill history](https://iframe.cob.org/iframes/pages/agenda-bill-history.aspx)

News
----

### [Subscribe to City Council news](https://cob.org/gov/council/subscribe-to-city-council-news)

[![People planting a tree](data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB3aWR0aD0iMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIxIiB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciPjwvc3ZnPg==)](https://cob.org/news/2025/elected-officials-visit-langley)

### [Bellingham and Langley City, B.C., leaders gather in unity](https://cob.org/news/2025/elected-officials-visit-langley)

September 12, 2025

City Council and the Mayor sent a letter to Langley and eight other British Columbia municipalities in May.

[![a rental sign](data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB3aWR0aD0iMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIxIiB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciPjwvc3ZnPg==)](https://cob.org/news/2025/council-approves-new-rental-fee-laws)

### [Council approves new rental fee laws](https://cob.org/news/2025/council-approves-new-rental-fee-laws)

June 24, 2025

New laws that regulate fees for rental units and manufactured/mobile home lots go into effect Aug. 1, 2025.

[![Sunset over Lake Whatcom from above](data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB3aWR0aD0iMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIxIiB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciPjwvc3ZnPg==)](https://cob.org/news/2025/annual-lake-whatcom-meeting-scheduled-for-april-2)

### [Annual Lake Whatcom meeting scheduled for April 2](https://cob.org/news/2025/annual-lake-whatcom-meeting-scheduled-for-april-2)

March 26, 2025

Community invited to learn more about lake health and management efforts

* [Council Rules of Procedure](https://cob.org/wp-content/uploads/Rules-of-Procedure-Updated-12-20-2022.pdf?type=archived)​
* [Legacies and Strategic Commitments](https://cob.org/wp-content/uploads/legacies-commitments.pdf?type=archived)
* [Past Mayors and Co​uncil Members](https://cob.org/gov/council/historic-councils)

City Council staff members
--------------------------

* Legislative Office Manager Jacqueline Weller, [jaweller@cob.org](mailto:jaweller@cob.org)
* Legislative Analyst Iris Nott, [ienott@cob.org](mailto:ienott@cob.org)
* Assistant Communications and Community Relations Director David Brauhn, [dmbrauhn@cob.org](mailto:dmbrauhn@cob.org)

Correspondence subject to public disclosure requirements

All correspondence sent to City employees is subject to public disclosure requirements under [state law](http://apps.leg.wa.gov/rcw/default.aspx?cite=42.56). Correspondence from members of the public will be disclosed to any person who [makes a request](https://cob.org/gov/public-records), unless exempt from disclosure under state law.

**Campaign-related correspondence prohibited**

By [state law](https://app.leg.wa.gov/RCW/default.aspx?cite=42.17A.555), public equipment, facilities, and employee work time may not be used to support or oppose candidates or ballot propositions. Please do not send campaign-related correspondence to City offices or employees.
